title: Introduction to Test Case Management with TestRail
note: Explains the need for a Test Case Management tool and introduces TestRail as a web-based solution for managing test cases, plans, and results.

title: Navigating the Dashboard and Projects
note: Provides a guided tour of the TestRail interface, including the main Dashboard for an overview and how to navigate into a specific Project.

title: Organizing Test Cases in Suites and Sections
note: Focuses on the 'Test Cases' tab. Explains how to use 'Test Suites' to group cases (e.g., by feature) and 'Sections' to create a folder-like hierarchy for organization.

title: Creating and Importing Test Cases
note: A practical guide to creating a test case with its standard fields (Title, Preconditions, Steps, Expected Result). Also covers bulk importing cases from a CSV file.

title: Efficiently Managing Suites with Bulk Editing
note: Demonstrates the bulk edit feature, a crucial tool for maintaining large test suites. Covers selecting multiple test cases to move, copy, or edit their properties all at once.

title: Test Case Versioning with Baselines
note: Introduces Test Case Baselines, which allow you to create a 'version' of your test suite. This is critical for projects with multiple releases in maintenance, as it lets you preserve the test suite as it was for a specific version while evolving it for the next.

title: Creating a Test Run
note: Introduces the 'Test Runs & Results' tab. Demonstrates how to create a Test Run by selecting which test cases to include, either all cases or a specific subset.

title: Executing Tests and Adding Results
note: Walks through the process of executing a test. Details the different statuses ('Passed', 'Failed', 'Blocked') and shows how to add comments and attach files like screenshots.

title: Grouping Runs with Test Plans
note: Introduces Test Plans as a way to group multiple Test Runs together, typically to manage the entire testing effort for a milestone or release.

title: Managing Test Configurations
note: Explains the powerful 'Configurations' feature within Test Plans. This allows you to create groups of test runs against different environments (e.g., Browsers: Chrome, Firefox; OS: Windows, macOS) and track results for each combination.

title: Tracking Progress with Milestones
note: Explains how to use Milestones to track major project phases. You can associate Test Plans with a milestone to get a high-level view of progress toward a release.

title: The 'Todos' Page for Task Management
note: Explains the 'Todos' page, which acts as a personal dashboard showing all tests assigned to you across all projects, making it easy to see your current workload.

title: Integration with Issue Trackers (e.g., Jira)
note: Covers the importance of integrating with an issue tracker. Demonstrates how to 'Push' a defect from a failed test result in TestRail to automatically create a bug report in Jira.

title: Reporting and Metrics
note: Covers TestRail's built-in reporting capabilities to generate summaries of test plans and runs, which can be used to communicate status to stakeholders.

title: Custom Reports and Dashboards
note: Explores advanced reporting. Covers how to create custom reports to meet specific needs, schedule reports to be sent automatically, and customize the project dashboard with charts to provide a real-time view of testing progress.

title: Introduction to the TestRail API
note: Provides a high-level overview of the TestRail API, explaining its role in integrating automated tests with TestRail for centralized reporting.

title: Practical API Usage: Adding a Test Result
note: Demonstrates a conceptual code example (e.g., in Python) showing how an automated test script would use the API to find a test case and post a result (e.g., 'Passed' or 'Failed') back to a specific Test Run in TestRail.

title: Administration: Customizing Fields
note: Covers how administrators can add custom fields to test cases, results, or projects to capture information specific to a team's workflow.

title: Administration: Managing Users and Roles
note: Provides an overview of user management. Shows how administrators can add users, organize them into groups, and assign roles and permissions to control access.
